alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Orange; Western Addison; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Lamoille, western Orange, central Addison, southeastern Chittenden, eastern Rutland, Windsor and Washington Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Starksboro to near Rochester to near Londonderry. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Barre, Rutland, Chester, Woodstock, Montpelier, Middlebury, Braintree Hill, Killington, Salisbury, Rutland City, Waterbury Village, Websterville, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Pomfret, Hartland, Middlesex, Mount Holly, Sharon, Washington and Ripton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 1 and 69. Interstate 91 between mile markers 39 and 49, between mile markers 51 and 61, and between mile markers 63 and 71, and near mile marker 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central, southern and northwestern Vermont.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Orange; Western Addison; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
